N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.32 - Executive order no. 32: renaming the new york state office of disaster preparedness to be the new york state emergency management office

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the Office of Disaster Preparedness, within the

Division of Military and Naval Affairs, is the disaster and civil defense
agency for the State of New York; and
WHEREAS, said Office of Disaster Preparedness is the focal
point for Federal, State and local government programs and organizations
involving emergency management; and
WHEREAS, the duties and responsibilities of the Office of

Disaster Preparedness has evolved over time and now include not only program
administration, but also activities associated with the prevention of, response
to, and recovery form all man-made and natural disasters; and
WHEREAS, the present title, "Office of Disaster

Preparedness" does not fully reflect the scope of the agency's duties and
responsibilities in protecting the lives and property of people of New York

State; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, under the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of the

State of New York, in order to promote more effective comprehensive emergency
management, do hereby direct that the New York State Office of Disaster

Preparedness be renamed the "New York State Emergency Management

Office."
Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: December 29, 1983
[FN[DOUBLE DAGGER]] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 9
(David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]
